questions.question_text: Which Excel view shows blue dashed lines indicating where pages will break when printed?
questions.explanation: Page Break Preview displays blue dashed lines showing automatic page breaks and allows you to manually adjust them.

questions.question_text: What is the keyboard shortcut to show formulas instead of values in Excel?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + ` (backtick) toggles between displaying formulas and their calculated values.

questions.question_text: How do you automatically adjust column width to fit the longest entry in Excel?
options: Double-click the right border of the column header
Home tab → Format → AutoFit Column Width
questions.explanation: All three methods will AutoFit a column to its contents. The keyboard shortcut is Alt + H, O, I.

questions.question_text: Which feature allows you to keep specific rows or columns visible while scrolling through a large worksheet?
questions.explanation: Freeze Panes (View tab → Freeze Panes) keeps selected rows/columns visible while scrolling.

questions.question_text: Where do you set up headers and footers for printing in Excel?
options: Page Layout tab → Page Setup dialog → Header/Footer tab
questions.explanation: Headers and footers can be accessed from both Page Layout tab (Page Setup dialog) and Insert tab (Header & Footer command).

questions.question_text: Which number format should you use for monetary values in a sales report?
questions.explanation: Both Currency and Accounting formats display monetary values. Accounting aligns currency symbols and decimal points in columns.

questions.question_text: How do you repeat specific rows at the top of every printed page?
options: Page Setup → Sheet tab → 'Rows to repeat at top'
Copy the header row to each page
questions.explanation: In Page Setup (Sheet tab), 'Rows to repeat at top' lets you specify header rows to print on every page. This is also called Print Titles.

questions.question_text: What does the 'Split' feature in Excel allow you to do?
options: Divide a cell into multiple cells
Divide the window into separate panes that scroll independently
questions.explanation: Split (View tab → Split) divides the Excel window into separate panes that can scroll independently.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a standard page orientation option in Excel?
options: Both are standard (A and B only)
questions.explanation: Excel offers Portrait (vertical) and Landscape (horizontal) orientations. 'Square' is not a standard page orientation.

questions.question_text: How do you set a specific range of cells as the area to be printed?
options: Select the range → File → Print → Print Selection
Select the range → Page Layout → Print Area → Set Print Area
Use the Print Preview dialog only
questions.explanation: Both methods work: setting Print Area or using Print Selection. Print Area is more permanent for the worksheet.

questions.question_text: Which margin option in Excel provides the smallest margins for maximum content on a page?
questions.explanation: Narrow margins (0.25 inches) provide the smallest margins, allowing more content on each printed page.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the 'Scale to Fit' options in Page Setup?
options: To adjust printout to fit a specific number of pages
questions.explanation: 'Scale to Fit' (Page Layout tab) adjusts printouts to fit on a specified number of pages wide/tall.

questions.question_text: Which feature allows you to save specific display settings (zoom, frozen panes, etc.) for quick switching?
questions.explanation: Custom Views (View tab → Custom Views) saves specific display/print settings for quick recall.

questions.question_text: How can you add a pre-filled date that updates automatically in a worksheet header?
options: Insert a formula in a cell and reference it in header
questions.explanation: &[Date] in a header/footer inserts the current date that updates each time the file is opened or printed.

questions.question_text: What does the 'Different first page' option in header/footer setup allow you to do?
options: Use a different header/footer only on page 1
Print the first page in color and others in black/white
Change margins for the first page only
Use different page orientation for the first page
questions.explanation: 'Different first page' allows unique headers/footers on the first page versus subsequent pages.
